meanings.definition: Capable of being trained or taught.
meanings.sent1: Puppies are trainable and can learn tricks quickly.
meanings.sent2: She found the new software to be very trainable with just a little guidance.
meanings.sent3: The robot thought it was trainable to make coffee, but ended up making a mess instead.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a trainable sponge, absorbing knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The concept of gravity is not easily trainable to young children.

meanings.definition: Able to learn or acquire new skills through instruction.
meanings.sent1: Children are very trainable when it comes to picking up new languages.
meanings.sent2: The employees proved to be highly trainable in adapting to the new technology.
meanings.sent3: The parrot thought it was trainable to speak French, but kept squawking in English instead.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a trainable computer, storing information efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's body was so trainable that he excelled in every sport he tried.

meanings.sent1: The spacious classroom was very trainable for hosting workshops.
meanings.sent2: The new recruits were all trainable candidates for the intensive program.
meanings.sent3: The old book claimed that even rocks were trainable with enough patience.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like a trainable canvas, ready to be filled with knowledge and wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The garden was so trainable that even the wildest plants grew beautifully under its care.
